intro: Mesembryanthemum fissum, commonly known as the African ice plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, often hairy leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday. Mesembryanthemum fissum is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
